title: COVID-19 Vaccine
cleaned_text: COVID-19 Vaccine Get Vaccinated Today. Everyone age 6 months and older is eligible for FREE COVID-19 vaccination regardless of health insurance status. Vaccines are available for individuals with health insurance at a variety of locations throughout the State of Delaware including at pharmacies, medical providers, hospital systems, employers, and other locations identified on vaccine.gov. For individuals who are uninsured or underinsured, free vaccines remain available at the State of Delaware Public Health Clinics and Federally Qualified Health Centers. You can also find these locations on vaccine.gov. The Federal Government is currently working on a program called the "Bridge Program" to partner with pharmacies and other locations to make these free vaccines for those who are uninsured or underinsured more conveniently available. Current vaccine options include [Pfizer (6 months+)](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/different-vaccines/Pfizer-BioNTech.html), [Moderna (6 months+)](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/different-vaccines/Moderna.html), [J & and Novavax (12 years+). Visit the [CDC's webpage with more information about staying up-to-date with your vaccines.](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/stay-up-to-date.html) Up-to-date means you have all recommended vaccines and boosters. [View instructions on how to search for your immunization records information](https://www.dhss.delaware.gov/dhss/dph/ipp/portalflyer.pdf). DPH does not replace lost vaccine cards, but Delawareans can find and print their (or their child's) vaccination record. Anyone who has difficulty finding their record can call 1-800-282-8672, or email [DelVAX@delaware.gov](mailto:DelVAX@delaware.gov). Responses to emails and calls received after regular business hours or on weekends may take up to 48 hours.
